Detailed Description

Interface for use with the ValueAnimator::setPointFEvaluator(PointFEvaluator) function.

PointFEvaluators allow developers to create animations on PointF types, by allowing them to supply custom evaulators for types that are not automatically understood and used by the animation system.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IPointFEvaluator. 

 class MyEvaluator : public IPointFEvaluator {
   public:
    MyEvaluator();
    ~MyEvaluator();
    virtual PointF* evaluate(float fraction, const PointF& startValue, const PointF& endValue);
 };

 PointF* MyEvaluator::evaluate(float fraction, const PointF& startValue, const PointF& endValue) {
   // Your implement
 }
 Keyframe *kf0 = Keyframe::ofPointFN(0.0f, mpPointF1);
 Keyframe *kf1 = Keyframe::ofPointFN(0.5f, mpPointF2);
 Keyframe *kf2 = Keyframe::ofPointFN(1.0f, mpPointF3);
 PropertyValuesHolder* pvhXy = PropertyValuesHolder::ofKeyframeN("Xy", 3, kf0, kf1, kf2);
 mpAnimator = ObjectAnimator::ofPropertyValuesHolderN(mpAnimatedObject, 1, pvhXy);
 mpEvaluator = new MyEvaluator();
 mpAnimator->setPointFEvaluator(mpEvaluator);
See also:
ValueAnimator::setPointFEvaluator(PointFEvaluator)

Member Function Documentation

virtual gaia::graphics::PointF* gaia::core::IPointFEvaluator::evaluate ( float  fraction,
gaia::graphics::PointF *  startValue,
gaia::graphics::PointF *  endValue 
) [pure virtual]

This function returns the result of linearly interpolating the start and end values, with fraction representing the proportion between the start and end values.

Parameters:
fractionThe fraction from the starting to the ending values
startValueThe start value.
endValueThe end value.
Returns:
A linear interpolation between the start and end values, given the fraction parameter.
